Key Match Events: Jason Holder struck with consecutive balls to finish with 4 for 7
West Indies won by nine wickets with 17 balls remaining
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies had been routed for 55 in their most recent meeting at the T20 World Cup in November
West Indies faced their own reckoning after losing an ODI series to Ireland only last week
Jason Holder served early notice with a career-best 4 for 7 in 3.4 overs
West Indies' openers knocked off 52 runs in the Powerplay, exactly half of the requirement
Miscellaneous Highlights: England lost ten wickets for 56 runs to sign off from the Ashes with a whimper
England's fourth-lowest total in T20I format was 103
Adil Rashid took four balls to gauge the pace of a high-kicking surface
Tom Banton clouted his third ball from Holder through the line for six before nicking his next to Pooran at a solitary wide slip
Moeen Ali made it more wickets than scoring shots by gliding an open-faced drive to backward point
Sam Billings was comprehensively stumped after galloping to the pitch of the spinner Akeal Hosein
Chris Jordan's three sixes in as many overs included a monster off Shepherd that rebounded off the scoreboard
